intro: Harpullia divaricata, commonly known as the variable harpullia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternate arrangement. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by distinctive orange to red fruits. It is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
